name: Gallbladder T
title: Clinical and Pathological T
notes: **Note:** Ignore extension from gallbladder to cystic duct.  Ignore extension to extrahepatic bile ducts or ampulla of Vater (T3) when other structures in T4 are involved.
rows:
Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
Tumor invades lamina propria or muscular layer

Note: T1 has subcategories of T1a and T1b. Assign T1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Confined to gallbladder, NOS
Localized, NOS

Stated as T1 [NOS]

Invasive tumor confined to:
    Lamina propria
    Mucosa, NOS
    Submucosa (superficial invasion)

Stated as T1a
Tumor invades perimuscular connective tissue; no extension beyond serosa or into liver

Perimuscular connective tissue

Stated as T2

Tumor perforates the serosa (visceral peritoneum) and/or directly involves the liver and/or one other adjacent organ or structure, such as stomach, duodenum, colon, pancreas, omentum, extrahepatic bile ducts

Invasion of/through serosa (visceral peritoneum)

Extension to:   
    Abdominal wall
    Ampulla of Vater
    Branch(es) of hepatic artery (right or left) but not into main portal vein or hepatic artery
    Branch(es) of portal vein (right or left)
    Cystic artery vein
    Diaphragm
    Small intestine

Extension into:
     Liver 

Stated as T3
Tumor invades main portal vein or hepatic artery or invades two or more extrahepatic organs or structures

Extension to:
    Common hepatic artery
    Main portal vein
    Hepatic artery, NOS
    Portal vein, NOS

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4
